word\/document.xml: CHAPTER TEN:
<g1>CHAPTER TEN:
word/document.xml
Crypto Class Theory and Free-Market Law</g1><x1/>Class theory underlies the free market and crypto: the state versus society.
Crypto Class Theory and Free-Market Law</g1><x1/>Class theory underlies the free market and crypto: the state versus society.
word/document.xml
Bitcoin was designed to bypass a central banking system that serves the political class at the expense of the economic one.
Bitcoin was designed to bypass a central banking system that serves the political class at the expense of the economic one.
word/document.xml

As an enemy of the state, crypto is an ally of society.<x2/><g2>Class Warfare and Crypto</g2><x3/>Many people assume that anything to do with banks and finance expresses the class interests of capitalists versus the common man.

As an enemy of the state, crypto is an ally of society.<x2/><g2>Class Warfare and Crypto</g2><x3/>Many people assume that anything to do with banks and finance expresses the class interests of capitalists versus the common man.
word/document.xml
The opposite is true, but the confusion is understandable.
The opposite is true, but the confusion is understandable.
word/document.xml

The word “capitalism” is commonly applied to crony capitalism these days—that is, an economic arrangement by which some businesses enjoy a close, mutually beneficial relationship with state officials and receive privileged treatment.

The word “capitalism” is commonly applied to crony capitalism these days—that is, an economic arrangement by which some businesses enjoy a close, mutually beneficial relationship with state officials and receive privileged treatment.
word/document.xml

A traditional “capitalist” is someone who owns and uses capital goods while remaining in society with no connection to the state; this economic arrangement is sometimes called “laissez-faire capitalism.”

A traditional “capitalist” is someone who owns and uses capital goods while remaining in society with no connection to the state; this economic arrangement is sometimes called “laissez-faire capitalism.”
word/document.xml

It is an expression of the free market and a benefit to the common man because laissez- faire capitalism acts as an engine of prosperity.<x4/>Central banking and most financial institutions express crony capitalism.

It is an expression of the free market and a benefit to the common man because laissez- faire capitalism acts as an engine of prosperity.<x4/>Central banking and most financial institutions express crony capitalism.
word/document.xml
Laissez- faire capitalism expresses the free market.
Laissez- faire capitalism expresses the free market.
word/document.xml
Thus a more specific statement of the class conflict is state and crony capitalism versus society and laissez-faire capitalism.
Thus a more specific statement of the class conflict is state and crony capitalism versus society and laissez-faire capitalism.
word/document.xml
In this conflict, crypto falls cleanly on the side of society.
In this conflict, crypto falls cleanly on the side of society.
word/document.xml
The class allegiance of crypto is evident from the remarkable parallels between its form and function and those of society.
The class allegiance of crypto is evident from the remarkable parallels between its form and function and those of society.
word/document.xml

The parallels include:<x5/>• The individual is the locus of power.<x6/>• Both are decentralized down to the level of the individual.<x7/>• Voluntaryism is the mode of operation.<x8/>• Their purpose is to facilitate exchanges, especially economic ones.<x9/>• Exchanges occur only if all involved consent.<x10/>• Trusted third parties are unnecessary.<x11/>• Privacy is preserved, if the participants wish to do so.<x12/>• There is no artificial barrier to entry.<x13/>• Neither has a single point of failure at which the entire system is vulnerable.

The parallels include:<x5/>• The individual is the locus of power.<x6/>• Both are decentralized down to the level of the individual.<x7/>• Voluntaryism is the mode of operation.<x8/>• Their purpose is to facilitate exchanges, especially economic ones.<x9/>• Exchanges occur only if all involved consent.<x10/>• Trusted third parties are unnecessary.<x11/>• Privacy is preserved, if the participants wish to do so.<x12/>• There is no artificial barrier to entry.<x13/>• Neither has a single point of failure at which the entire system is vulnerable.
word/document.xml

• Wealth is being constantly created.<x14/>• Wealth and status are based on merit, such as hard work.<x15/>• Exchanges are not based on ideology or politics.<x16/>• Reputations matter.<x17/>• The state is the class enemy.<x18/>By contrast, the form and function of the state is antithetical to crypto and the free market.<x19/>• The state is the locus of power.<x20/>• All power is centralized into bureaucracies.<x21/>• Coercion is its mode of operation.<x22/>• The state’s purpose is to maintain its own existence.<x23/>• Forced transfers of wealth and power to benefit of the state.<x24/>• It is the ultimate third party.<x25/>• Privacy is frowned upon and undercut at every turn.<x26/>• Barriers to entry are erected, sometimes amounting to prohibitions.

• Wealth is being constantly created.<x14/>• Wealth and status are based on merit, such as hard work.<x15/>• Exchanges are not based on ideology or politics.<x16/>• Reputations matter.<x17/>• The state is the class enemy.<x18/>By contrast, the form and function of the state is antithetical to crypto and the free market.<x19/>• The state is the locus of power.<x20/>• All power is centralized into bureaucracies.<x21/>• Coercion is its mode of operation.<x22/>• The state’s purpose is to maintain its own existence.<x23/>• Forced transfers of wealth and power to benefit of the state.<x24/>• It is the ultimate third party.<x25/>• Privacy is frowned upon and undercut at every turn.<x26/>• Barriers to entry are erected, sometimes amounting to prohibitions.
word/document.xml

• Those in power are the system’s point of failure.<x27/>• No wealth is created.<x28/>• Wealth and power are based on politics.<x29/>• Wealth is accumulated through theft and privilege.<x30/>• Reputation is not necessary and less important than status.<x31/>• Society is the class enemy.<x32/>Another litmus test of whether crypto serves the state or society is rooted in the answers to two questions about money.

• Those in power are the system’s point of failure.<x27/>• No wealth is created.<x28/>• Wealth and power are based on politics.<x29/>• Wealth is accumulated through theft and privilege.<x30/>• Reputation is not necessary and less important than status.<x31/>• Society is the class enemy.<x32/>Another litmus test of whether crypto serves the state or society is rooted in the answers to two questions about money.
word/document.xml
word/document.xml
Who issues it?
Who issues it?
word/document.xml
Fiat is issued either by the state or by an authority controlled by the state, with competition prohibited by law.
Fiat is issued either by the state or by an authority controlled by the state, with competition prohibited by law.
word/document.xml
Crypto is issued by entrepreneurs who compete vigorously with each other for popular acceptance.
Crypto is issued by entrepreneurs who compete vigorously with each other for popular acceptance.
word/document.xml
word/document.xml
Can people choose to use the currency or not?
Can people choose to use the currency or not?
word/document.xml
The state requires people to accept its fiat as legal tender.
The state requires people to accept its fiat as legal tender.
word/document.xml

Crypto leaves the decision up to individual.<x33/>Perhaps the greatest threat to unregulated crypto is the state’s drive to change the form and function of crypto so that it no longer expresses and enriches society but expresses and enriches the state.

Crypto leaves the decision up to individual.<x33/>Perhaps the greatest threat to unregulated crypto is the state’s drive to change the form and function of crypto so that it no longer expresses and enriches society but expresses and enriches the state.
word/document.xml
The state wanted to sculpt crypto into its own image through state-issuance, regulation, and other measures so that it<x34/>becomes a type of fiat crypto.
The state wanted to sculpt crypto into its own image through state-issuance, regulation, and other measures so that it<x34/>becomes a type of fiat crypto.
word/document.xml
This cannot be done; the blockchain cannot be centralized under a single authority.
This cannot be done; the blockchain cannot be centralized under a single authority.
word/document.xml
No blending of inherently antagonistic forces is possible.
No blending of inherently antagonistic forces is possible.
word/document.xml
It is not even clear that state and free-market cryptos can co-exist.<x35/>The state will keep attempting to forge a bastardized crypto, however, until it is convinced that efforts are futile.
It is not even clear that state and free-market cryptos can co-exist.<x35/>The state will keep attempting to forge a bastardized crypto, however, until it is convinced that efforts are futile.
word/document.xml
At this point, crypto will cease to be viewed as an opportunity and be seen as a danger.
At this point, crypto will cease to be viewed as an opportunity and be seen as a danger.
word/document.xml
The very existence of free-market crypto encroaches on an irreplaceable source of state power—the issuance of money.
The very existence of free-market crypto encroaches on an irreplaceable source of state power—the issuance of money.
word/document.xml

Crypto has the ability to weaken this source of power and, perhaps, to destroy it.<x36/>The features of crypto that weaken the state include:<x37/>• Peer-to-peer transfers deny wealth by sidestepping central banks through which the financial flow is controlled.<x38/>• The privacy of crypto hinders the state’s campaign of social control.

Crypto has the ability to weaken this source of power and, perhaps, to destroy it.<x36/>The features of crypto that weaken the state include:<x37/>• Peer-to-peer transfers deny wealth by sidestepping central banks through which the financial flow is controlled.<x38/>• The privacy of crypto hinders the state’s campaign of social control.
word/document.xml

The data from financial institutions that report on their customers are vital to the<x39/>state’s ability to impose social and economic control.<x40/>• Privacy also sidesteps the centralization of the state.

The data from financial institutions that report on their customers are vital to the<x39/>state’s ability to impose social and economic control.<x40/>• Privacy also sidesteps the centralization of the state.
word/document.xml
The state can almost be defined as the centralization of power to benefit the elite.<x41/>• Crypto’s existence raises the question of whether the state is necessary.
The state can almost be defined as the centralization of power to benefit the elite.<x41/>• Crypto’s existence raises the question of whether the state is necessary.
word/document.xml

If the free market can so easily assume one essential state function—the<x42/>issuance and circulation of currency—then why can’t it assume others, or them all?<x43/>Crypto is the money of society; it cannot and does not serve the state.<x44/><g3>Law Enforcement as a Tool of Class Warfare</g3><x45/>The government’s coercive taxing power necessarily creates two classes: those who create and those who consume the wealth expropriated and transferred by that power.

If the free market can so easily assume one essential state function—the<x42/>issuance and circulation of currency—then why can’t it assume others, or them all?<x43/>Crypto is the money of society; it cannot and does not serve the state.<x44/><g3>Law Enforcement as a Tool of Class Warfare</g3><x45/>The government’s coercive taxing power necessarily creates two classes: those who create and those who consume the wealth expropriated and transferred by that power.
word/document.xml
Those who create the wealth naturally want to keep it and devote it to their own purposes.
Those who create the wealth naturally want to keep it and devote it to their own purposes.
word/document.xml
Those who wish to expropriate it look for ever more-clever ways to acquire it without inciting resistance.
Those who wish to expropriate it look for ever more-clever ways to acquire it without inciting resistance.
word/document.xml
One of those ways is the spreading of an elaborate ideology of statism, which teaches that the people are the state and that therefore they are only paying themselves when they pay taxes.
One of those ways is the spreading of an elaborate ideology of statism, which teaches that the people are the state and that therefore they are only paying themselves when they pay taxes.
word/document.xml
The state’s officers and the court intellectuals at universities and the news media go to great lengths to have people believe this fantastic story, including the setting up of schools.
The state’s officers and the court intellectuals at universities and the news media go to great lengths to have people believe this fantastic story, including the setting up of schools.
word/document.xml

Alas, most people come to believe it.—<g4>Sheldon Richman</g4><x46/>One of the most powerful weapons the state possesses in the class warfare it wages against society is law enforcement, including legislation and the court system through which the state asserts its class privileges.

Alas, most people come to believe it.—<g4>Sheldon Richman</g4><x46/>One of the most powerful weapons the state possesses in the class warfare it wages against society is law enforcement, including legislation and the court system through which the state asserts its class privileges.
word/document.xml
Law is integral to the state’s monopoly on force and its ability to coerce the transfer of wealth from society into its own hands.
Law is integral to the state’s monopoly on force and its ability to coerce the transfer of wealth from society into its own hands.
word/document.xml

Without a monopoly on law enforcement, it is difficult to imagine how the state could win the class conflict because society enjoys the enormous advantages of being productivity, innovation, and energetic.<x47/>The state invests immense time and money in convincing society that law enforcement is a protection, not a threat.

Without a monopoly on law enforcement, it is difficult to imagine how the state could win the class conflict because society enjoys the enormous advantages of being productivity, innovation, and energetic.<x47/>The state invests immense time and money in convincing society that law enforcement is a protection, not a threat.
word/document.xml

As a state drifts closer to totalitarianism, however, it becomes more difficult to maintain this deception because its guns— that is, the industries of law enforcement—become more visible.<x48/>One of the final tools the state wields to retain legitimacy before it has to start using guns is the T.I.N.A. argument: there is no alternative.

As a state drifts closer to totalitarianism, however, it becomes more difficult to maintain this deception because its guns— that is, the industries of law enforcement—become more visible.<x48/>One of the final tools the state wields to retain legitimacy before it has to start using guns is the T.I.N.A. argument: there is no alternative.
word/document.xml
The state incites fear of a terrible enemy—terrorists, perhaps—and then assures society that armed guards at airports, surveillance cameras, and a militarized police force are necessary.
The state incites fear of a terrible enemy—terrorists, perhaps—and then assures society that armed guards at airports, surveillance cameras, and a militarized police force are necessary.
word/document.xml
Besides which, there is no alternative.
Besides which, there is no alternative.
word/document.xml
Or, rather, the only alternative is terrorism.
Or, rather, the only alternative is terrorism.
word/document.xml

Many will believe this false choice and accept the lesser of two evils.<x49/>Happily, there is an alternative: free market law.<x50/><g5>Free-Market Law</g5><x51/>There’s an important distinction between legislation and law.

Many will believe this false choice and accept the lesser of two evils.<x49/>Happily, there is an alternative: free market law.<x50/><g5>Free-Market Law</g5><x51/>There’s an important distinction between legislation and law.
word/document.xml
Legislation is the law that comes from political action...Law is more general in that legislation is a form of law, but law can also be the kind of law that evolves through human interaction.
Legislation is the law that comes from political action...Law is more general in that legislation is a form of law, but law can also be the kind of law that evolves through human interaction.
word/document.xml

In England and the United States we are often referred to as ‘common law’ countries and that’s because a great deal, and in fact, the majority of our law came about through an evolutionary process that didn’t involve the action of political representatives.—<g6>John Hasnas</g6><x52/>There oughta be a law.

In England and the United States we are often referred to as ‘common law’ countries and that’s because a great deal, and in fact, the majority of our law came about through an evolutionary process that didn’t involve the action of political representatives.—<g6>John Hasnas</g6><x52/>There oughta be a law.
word/document.xml
The meaning of this statement depends on the definition of “law.”
The meaning of this statement depends on the definition of “law.”
word/document.xml
The state treats the word as a synonym for legislation or statutory law, which is law that results from a political process.
The state treats the word as a synonym for legislation or statutory law, which is law that results from a political process.
word/document.xml
Any person or group who holds sufficient power can pass legislation and use law enforcement to impose it on society.
Any person or group who holds sufficient power can pass legislation and use law enforcement to impose it on society.
word/document.xml
This is a trickle-down, centralized model by which an upper class determines how the lower class should behave.
This is a trickle-down, centralized model by which an upper class determines how the lower class should behave.
word/document.xml
The effect of upper class decisions flows down vertically into the lives of lower-class people.
The effect of upper class decisions flows down vertically into the lives of lower-class people.
word/document.xml

Just one danger to a top- down system is that human beings act in their own self-interest, and legislated law is likely to reflect the interests of politicians rather than those of the people upon whom it is imposed.

Just one danger to a top- down system is that human beings act in their own self-interest, and legislated law is likely to reflect the interests of politicians rather than those of the people upon whom it is imposed.
word/document.xml
The system is a formula for corruption and a gateway for the state to expand ever deeper into society.<x53/>Can there be viable law without the state?
The system is a formula for corruption and a gateway for the state to expand ever deeper into society.<x53/>Can there be viable law without the state?
word/document.xml

Anarchists and advocates of limited government have debated this question for centuries, with many free-market voices concluding that law must emanate from the state in much the same manner as they believe money must.

Anarchists and advocates of limited government have debated this question for centuries, with many free-market voices concluding that law must emanate from the state in much the same manner as they believe money must.
word/document.xml
Law is a human need without which civil society is unlikely to last long.
Law is a human need without which civil society is unlikely to last long.
word/document.xml
If the free market cannot provide this essential good, then anarchism fails and limited government is the most practical alternative.
If the free market cannot provide this essential good, then anarchism fails and limited government is the most practical alternative.
word/document.xml
Society will become a junior partner to the state.
Society will become a junior partner to the state.
word/document.xml
The eternal struggle between Liberty and Power of which Rothbard wrote will be over, with Power declaring victory.<x54/>It is useful approach to begin by defining the term “law.”
The eternal struggle between Liberty and Power of which Rothbard wrote will be over, with Power declaring victory.<x54/>It is useful approach to begin by defining the term “law.”
word/document.xml
Law is a more general term than “legislation,” which is merely one form of law; the general term refers<x55/>to any code or set of rules that govern human interaction.
Law is a more general term than “legislation,” which is merely one form of law; the general term refers<x55/>to any code or set of rules that govern human interaction.
word/document.xml
“Govern” does not imply a state.<x56/>The answer:
“Govern” does not imply a state.<x56/>The answer:
word/document.xml
“yes, it can.”
“yes, it can.”
word/document.xml
For one thing, society precedes the state, which must arise out of human beings gathering to interact.
For one thing, society precedes the state, which must arise out of human beings gathering to interact.
word/document.xml
Society precedes both the state and law.<x57/>Another reason free-market law can exist is because it already has.<x58/>A popular form of free-market law is called common or customary law.
Society precedes both the state and law.<x57/>Another reason free-market law can exist is because it already has.<x58/>A popular form of free-market law is called common or customary law.
word/document.xml
This is a set of rules based on precedents that evolve through time to resolve disputes in a specific community.
This is a set of rules based on precedents that evolve through time to resolve disputes in a specific community.
word/document.xml
It is not preemptive but reactive.
It is not preemptive but reactive.
word/document.xml
When a dispute erupts, the parties go to an impartial third party or to a community assembly to have their cases heard.
When a dispute erupts, the parties go to an impartial third party or to a community assembly to have their cases heard.
word/document.xml

In a rural community, for example, if one man accuses another of stealing a farm animal, then the arbitrator assesses the case and applies a community standard that has emerged from similar cases in the past.

In a rural community, for example, if one man accuses another of stealing a farm animal, then the arbitrator assesses the case and applies a community standard that has emerged from similar cases in the past.
word/document.xml
Since the adjudicators themselves could be involved in a future community dispute, they have a vested interest in infusing the proceedings with common sense.<x59/>This is grassroots law.
Since the adjudicators themselves could be involved in a future community dispute, they have a vested interest in infusing the proceedings with common sense.<x59/>This is grassroots law.
word/document.xml
It is decentralized law that does not have the broad application of federal statutes because it is tailored to local circumstances and standards.
It is decentralized law that does not have the broad application of federal statutes because it is tailored to local circumstances and standards.
word/document.xml
A fishing village would almost certainly evolve different rules of behavior than a mining town, for example.
A fishing village would almost certainly evolve different rules of behavior than a mining town, for example.
word/document.xml
Rules governing the crypto community would differ from rules within the construction industry.
Rules governing the crypto community would differ from rules within the construction industry.
word/document.xml

As long as the purpose is to preserve peaceful interaction and to rectify breaches, there is no right or wrong to the specific content of the law.<x60/>Legal scholar John Hasnas explains:<x61/>Customary law is the type of law that evolves when disputes arise...Over the decades and centuries, as things evolved, the decision maker became more and more specialized and by the time you get to the Norman era in England, decisions are made by juries.

As long as the purpose is to preserve peaceful interaction and to rectify breaches, there is no right or wrong to the specific content of the law.<x60/>Legal scholar John Hasnas explains:<x61/>Customary law is the type of law that evolves when disputes arise...Over the decades and centuries, as things evolved, the decision maker became more and more specialized and by the time you get to the Norman era in England, decisions are made by juries.
word/document.xml

Juries are still drawn from the ordinary people in the country...In our system, you don’t have the courts organized into a hierarchal fashion until the late 19th century, so it’s 1873 and 1875.<x62/>Can a complex modern society function without a homogenized set of rules that are mandated?

Juries are still drawn from the ordinary people in the country...In our system, you don’t have the courts organized into a hierarchal fashion until the late 19th century, so it’s 1873 and 1875.<x62/>Can a complex modern society function without a homogenized set of rules that are mandated?
word/document.xml

Can grassroots decentralized law work within a far larger framework than a fishing village or a rural community?<x63/>The prospect has been discussed for centuries.<x64/><g7>The First Discussion of Free-Market Law and Defense Systems</g7><x65/>All around us are the almost unimaginable benefits of markets, cooperation, and technology, yet somehow we’re naïve if we don’t want to funnel human activity through government cattle chutes.

Can grassroots decentralized law work within a far larger framework than a fishing village or a rural community?<x63/>The prospect has been discussed for centuries.<x64/><g7>The First Discussion of Free-Market Law and Defense Systems</g7><x65/>All around us are the almost unimaginable benefits of markets, cooperation, and technology, yet somehow we’re naïve if we don’t want to funnel human activity through government cattle chutes.
word/document.xml
The vast material and digital abundance we enjoy every day is provided without any state apparatus, in<x66/>fact <g8>in spite of </g8>that apparatus.
The vast material and digital abundance we enjoy every day is provided without any state apparatus, in<x66/>fact <g8>in spite of </g8>that apparatus.
word/document.xml
Is this private world not part of reality?
Is this private world not part of reality?
word/document.xml

Government is the artifice, and statists are the utopian dreamers who imagine that individuals acting under the magical banner of government can plan, coerce, and coordinate millions of lives.—<g9>Jeff Deist</g9><x67/>The 19th-century classical liberal Gustave de Molinari respected the free market so deeply that colleagues referred to him as “the law of supply and demand made into man.”

Government is the artifice, and statists are the utopian dreamers who imagine that individuals acting under the magical banner of government can plan, coerce, and coordinate millions of lives.—<g9>Jeff Deist</g9><x67/>The 19th-century classical liberal Gustave de Molinari respected the free market so deeply that colleagues referred to him as “the law of supply and demand made into man.”
word/document.xml
Highly praised in his day, Molinari has fallen into obscurity.
Highly praised in his day, Molinari has fallen into obscurity.
word/document.xml
His legacy should be retrieved, however, because he raised a pivotal issue.
His legacy should be retrieved, however, because he raised a pivotal issue.
word/document.xml

Why is security a service monopolized by the state rather than performed by a free market that provides all other services more efficiently and inexpensively?<x68/>Molinari is the first explicit precursor to free-market anarchism.

Why is security a service monopolized by the state rather than performed by a free market that provides all other services more efficiently and inexpensively?<x68/>Molinari is the first explicit precursor to free-market anarchism.
word/document.xml

<g10>Rothbard allude s</g10><x69/>to his 1849 essay, “The Production of Security,” as “the first presentation anywhere in human history of what is now called ‘anarcho-capitalism’ or ‘free market anarchism’.”

<g10>Rothbard allude s</g10><x69/>to his 1849 essay, “The Production of Security,” as “the first presentation anywhere in human history of what is now called ‘anarcho-capitalism’ or ‘free market anarchism’.”
word/document.xml
Core to Molinari’s anarchism is his theory of how society arises.<x70/>There are two ways of considering society.
Core to Molinari’s anarchism is his theory of how society arises.<x70/>There are two ways of considering society.
word/document.xml
According to some, the development of human associations is not subject to providential, unchangeable laws.
According to some, the development of human associations is not subject to providential, unchangeable laws.
word/document.xml

Rather, these associations, having originally been organized in a purely artificial manner by primeval legislators, can later be modified or remade by other legislators, in step with the progress of <g11>social science</g11>.

Rather, these associations, having originally been organized in a purely artificial manner by primeval legislators, can later be modified or remade by other legislators, in step with the progress of <g11>social science</g11>.
word/document.xml

In this system the government plays a preeminent role, because it is upon it, the custodian of the principle of authority, that the daily task of modifying and remaking society devolves.<x71/>According to others, on the contrary, society is a purely natural fact.

In this system the government plays a preeminent role, because it is upon it, the custodian of the principle of authority, that the daily task of modifying and remaking society devolves.<x71/>According to others, on the contrary, society is a purely natural fact.
word/document.xml
Like the earth on which it stands, society moves in accordance with general, preexisting laws.
Like the earth on which it stands, society moves in accordance with general, preexisting laws.
word/document.xml

In this system, there is no such thing, strictly speaking, as social science; there is only economic science, which studies the natural organism of society and shows how this organism functions.<x72/>Molinari believes men form society out of self-interest to satisfy the same “instinct of sociability” displayed by other high-order animals; sociability was built into man’s nature in much way as hunger.

In this system, there is no such thing, strictly speaking, as social science; there is only economic science, which studies the natural organism of society and shows how this organism functions.<x72/>Molinari believes men form society out of self-interest to satisfy the same “instinct of sociability” displayed by other high-order animals; sociability was built into man’s nature in much way as hunger.
word/document.xml

Society is spontaneously organized for the purpose of making broadly defined exchanges; these are the proper sphere of economic study, not of social science.<x73/>Molinari presents three methods by which any good or service can be produced.<x74/>• The first method is to grant a monopoly to a privileged entity.

Society is spontaneously organized for the purpose of making broadly defined exchanges; these are the proper sphere of economic study, not of social science.<x73/>Molinari presents three methods by which any good or service can be produced.<x74/>• The first method is to grant a monopoly to a privileged entity.
word/document.xml
This is what happens when the state is given a monopoly on the use of force and law<x75/>within a jurisdiction.
This is what happens when the state is given a monopoly on the use of force and law<x75/>within a jurisdiction.
word/document.xml
Dissenting individuals are forced to obey, or they are silenced.<x76/>• The second is through a collective that produces a service that is said to benefit society in general.
Dissenting individuals are forced to obey, or they are silenced.<x76/>• The second is through a collective that produces a service that is said to benefit society in general.
word/document.xml
Authority vested in a democracy is an example.<x77/>This less centralized form of control is no less dangerous for a dissenting individual.<x78/>• The third is free-market competition.
Authority vested in a democracy is an example.<x77/>This less centralized form of control is no less dangerous for a dissenting individual.<x78/>• The third is free-market competition.
word/document.xml
The authority resides with individuals who are businessmen and customers.
The authority resides with individuals who are businessmen and customers.
word/document.xml
Individuals freely choose to do<x79/>business or not.<x80/>All services and goods should be purely economic matters, including security and defense.
Individuals freely choose to do<x79/>business or not.<x80/>All services and goods should be purely economic matters, including security and defense.
word/document.xml
Like every other service that fills a human need, security is best provided by a free market in which individuals wield the ultimate power of “yes” or “no.”
Like every other service that fills a human need, security is best provided by a free market in which individuals wield the ultimate power of “yes” or “no.”
word/document.xml
Molinari is the first theorist to present a cohesive argument on how free-market mechanisms can replace the so-called essential functions of the State, especially protection against aggression.
Molinari is the first theorist to present a cohesive argument on how free-market mechanisms can replace the so-called essential functions of the State, especially protection against aggression.

He writes:<x92/>That in the state of nature every one has the executive power of the law of nature, I doubt not, but it will be objected, that it is unreasonable for men to be judges in their own cases, that self-love will make men partial to themselves and their friends: and on the other side, that ill-nature, passion and revenge will carry them too far in punishing others; and hence nothing but confusion and disorder will follow.<x93/>It is unwise for men to judge their own cases because the act will produce conflict in society.
